metadata.title: CVE-2017-15399 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use after free in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 62.0.3202.89 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15399` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu1.1386
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu1.1386
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu1.1386
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu1.1386
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu1.1386
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu1.1386').
